headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; The Case of Miss Jacksen. BOARD OF GOVERNORS. BODY FOUND IN THE RIVER. ATTEMPT AT BURGLARY. FATAL RAILROAD ACCIDENT. FELL THROUGH A HATCHWAY. BURNED TO DEATH.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Governors of the Almshouse met on Tuesday at the Lunatic Asylum, Blackwell's Island, the President, G. C. GUNTEER, Esq., in the Chair. After the residing of the minutes, the following communication to the Board was read by the Clerk: To Joshua Phillips. Clerk of the Board of Governors: DEAR SIB--Your note of the 7th inst.,

docs.lead_paragraph: A SPECIMEN FROM MR. SPURGEON.--As an illustration of the style of sermonizing which characterizes Mr. SPURGEON, the following will answer pretty well, both in respect to matter and manner: "Now," we quote from one of his recent sermons, "if I wished to test you all, and might ask you only one question, I would ask this: What is your righteousness? Now come along, in single file.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Aldermen adopted, on Monday evening last, the specifications which had been reported two days before, by the Committee on Conference, to whom the subject of Street Cleaning had been referred.
docs.snippet: The Board of Aldermen adopted, on Monday evening last, the specifications which had been reported two days before, by the Committee on Conference, to whom the subject of Street Cleaning had been referred.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times: Your Chicago correspondent "Shibboleth," seems to have had some very sad experience in the West; and yet he is inclined to live there, with such part of him as remains for life to cling to. It is unquestionably true, that the early settlers of any country have to contend with disease and sickness in various forms.

docs.lead_paragraph: From the New-Orleans Picayune, 7th. By the way of Havana, we have two weeks later intelligence from all parts of the Mexican Republic, from Vera Cruz to the 20th ult., and the City of Mexico to the 16th. The Santa Ana conspirators, 21 in number, arrested at the capital the 26th of May, had all made good their escape.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Advance Wages. Old Abuses of Seamer and new Remedies. SEWING MACHINES. THE PORT BILL IN OPERATION. INCREASE OF THE STEAM MARINE OF GREAT BRITAIN.--But few of our commercial men, perhaps, HOW THE NO-ADVANCE PLAN WORKS. National Hotel Epidemic at Washington--Report of the New-York Academy.. THE BRIG ELLEN DISCHARGED. Why Men struggle to get into the Custom-Houses.

docs.lead_paragraph: An article on the above-named subject in your columns of the 9th inst., propounded an important question, which, with your permission, I will try in some measure to answer, That question is: "How is it likely to work?"

headline.main: The Health of the City of New-Orleans.

docs.lead_paragraph: SANITARY CONDITION OF THE SECOND WARD Since May 1 Health-Warden GILBERT has examined every block in his Ward, besides attending to miscellaneous sanitary matters from day to day. He has passed, to his credit, over 200 abatements ;
docs.snippet: SANITARY CONDITION OF THE SECOND WARD Since May 1 Health-Warden GILBERT has examined every block in his Ward, besides attending to miscellaneous sanitary matters from day to day. He has passed, to his credit, over 200 abatements ;

docs.lead_paragraph: Yesterday the Health Officer arrested seven other persons for violating the Quarantine rules. Their names are, James McCarty, George Horan, John Magee, John Murray, Hugh Donagle, Wm. McDaavitt and Patrick Magee. These persons had stolen a boat

headline.main: Western Emigration and Experience--The other Side of the Picture.

docs.lead_paragraph: In your paper of the 8th inst., I notice a communication from Mound City, Pulaski, Ill., of date June 80, 1857, signed " Vise," headed " A Word About Western Emigration and Western Experience," and think the writer very modest in his remarks and not half severe, enough upon what are called "Land pirates and paper-town speculators."
